channel.title: [WiP]Link | Version 2.0 |[WiP]
channel.description:
Well, I asked Frell if I could show you the model im currently working on, which is Link (from Zelda games ofcourse). Its not near completion but here it goes:
[Version 1.0] [hr] Screenshots: [IMG]http://i369.photobucket.com/albums/oo131/0xXDylanXx0/Link%20Project/Link1.jpg[/img] Wireframe [IMG]http://i369.photobucket.com/albums/oo131/0xXDylanXx0/Link%20Project/Link2.jpg[/img] Please note that i did not use any tracing, or create tools. This is 100% primitives. I made sure to keep rough edge feature on so that you could see structure. [hr] [Version 1.2] First render ever. Hands were fun in an annoying way. [IMG]http://i369.photobucket.com/albums/oo131/0xXDylanXx0/Link%20Project/R1.jpg[/img] [Version 1.3] [IMG]http://i369.photobucket.com/albums/oo131/0xXDylanXx0/Link%20Project/R2.jpg[/img] Well, I added a base for the legs. They will be modified. Also, I corrected some colors. [br] [Version 2.0] Well, this version was texturing the main tunic and the undershirt of it. Full texturing comes later. [IMG]http://i369.photobucket.com/albums/oo131/0xXDylanXx0/Link%20Project/V2R4.jpg[/img] This render shows the sword, for those of you who are wondering what I did with it. I tried to 'spice' it up a bit from the origional. Not sure what to think of it so I'm open to criticism. [IMG]http://i369.photobucket.com/albums/oo131/0xXDylanXx0/Link%20Project/V2R5.jpg[/img] This one is with the sword sheathed, to show how it would look normally. [IMG]http://i369.photobucket.com/albums/oo131/0xXDylanXx0/Link%20Project/V2R1.jpg[/img] Side view to show what I spent a lot of time on, trying to shape it more correctly. I think it turned out great with the help of Frell's criticism over MSN.
Wire Frames: [IMG]http://i369.photobucket.com/albums/oo131/0xXDylanXx0/Link%20Project/V2W3.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://i369.photobucket.com/albums/oo131/0xXDylanXx0/Link%20Project/V2W2.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://i369.photobucket.com/albums/oo131/0xXDylanXx0/Link%20Project/V2W1.jpg[/img]
Just a note: the way I took these wasnt the best way, so their are some lines which don't fit in and just 'hover' on the model. Ignore them.

item.title: [WiP]Link | Version 2.0 |[WiP]
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

If you really want my criticism, here it is.

Some parts of the model seem awkward to me. Speaking more-so towards the body rather than the model itself, it doesn’t give the feel of a large shirt (which Link is wearing) over a semi-muscular body frame. Meaning is you formed the shirt to fixate itself onto the body and not flow, hence why it’s tightened with the belt, which is where most of the muscular features should be visible, the rest, not so much. Boots are a bit large (from the top of the sole to the top of the foot part of his boots) but I can get over that, somewhat.

You can see what I’m talking about in this picture.

V2R1.jpg853×1024

Take a look at where the chest starts and the belt. The shirt should only be so tight around the belt area, not all the way around.

Read full topic

MITB may have less in the graphic section, but there atleast you’ll get some REAL feedback

I planned to put it on MITB from the start. I just want to make it presentable to MITB before I post it.[/quote]
Makes sense. Can we see an update on the model?

item.title: [WiP]Link | Version 2.0 |[WiP]
item.dc:creator: @man_killerx man_killerx
item.description:
@man_killerx wrote:

Okay, People are leaving some stupid comments.
1.) DO PEOPLE NOT KNOW WHAT THE FUCK WIP MEANS?
For those retards it means “WORK IN PROGRESS” WOW!
Okay I will branch it further sence it still doesn’t make sence,
Work - To do manual labor (The modeling)
In - A mixed noun for a place.
Progress - Meaning not 100% But working twords finished.

He needs improvement comments not “Looks like boobs” ones.
Also, How the hell could this possibly be leeched. You can tell he started from scratch in the first picture due to some extra lines.

Here is what I would fix on it so far,
1.) Add progression colours. (Light green working to dark green, Dark green under the arms ECT.)
2.) The under shirt near the bottom looks a little plain, Try adding textures to that too.
3.) Smooth the textures out because they look a little too streched. (Legs, the body is fine)
4.) The strap across his chest could be a little more defined.
5.) The sword looks just a little big, Imagine trying to pull that from your back, That would be a pain in the ass.
6.) Like others said add wrinkles but I am sure you could do that with the textures.

I liked your 1.3 version leg colour a little better, Maybe add texture to it and darken it a little. Also after looking at the legs wireframe I noticed some “Squares” that were not connected. In the front, That might mess with the bones when you are animating it. Back of the legs look a little too pushed in, Just drag them back a little.

Is there any sections in the fingers for the bones? Because who wants stiff fingers.
That and I can’t see any knee’s Or are those covered by the boots?

Read full topic

item.title: [WiP]Link | Version 2.0 |[WiP]
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“rip4d, post:54, topic:335738”][quote author=dylan_0789 link=topic=432119.msg3174445#msg3174445 date=1270698280]
Mines 4500 poly count. Ive shown you multiple screenshots and wireframes FROM the beginning. Plus, mines pretty flawwed. Only on mopar do people make boob statements and accuse novice modelers of theft without credit. Tbh, with some of the comments you guys leave, I’m thinking I should quit posting here. Sorry I made an anatomically correct human. Sorry I didn’t follow the origional exactly which was made as low poly as possible for games. If you guys would rather it, I wont post my work for you.
[/quote]I wouldn’t stop posting because a bunch of newfags and cocoa made comments about manboobs. You’re one of our most talented modelers here at Mopar, and this section would be full of a shitton of shitty models with no improvement since it seems nobody else can give good CC.[/quote]
I’d stop posting because nobody can give Criticism. Why would I post it somewhere I get no comments which furthur the production of my work?
[/quote]
Ok.
The arm guards are more metallish, not this material you have them as.
still haven’t redone the boots. They need to be squarish.
The shirt has non of the little XXXXXX details.
Wrinkleless
The legs between the skirt to boots are to fat and should be trimmed in.
The legs don’t fit the boots.
Fingers look 2 square
decapitation.

Read full topic

[/quote][/quote]
You didnt offend me. How can my comment be unnecessary? I explained to you something that was unclearly sarcastic…

[quote=“rip4d, post:54, topic:335738”][quote author=dylan_0789 link=topic=432119.msg3174445#msg3174445 date=1270698280]
Mines 4500 poly count. Ive shown you multiple screenshots and wireframes FROM the beginning. Plus, mines pretty flawwed. Only on mopar do people make boob statements and accuse novice modelers of theft without credit. Tbh, with some of the comments you guys leave, I’m thinking I should quit posting here. Sorry I made an anatomically correct human. Sorry I didn’t follow the origional exactly which was made as low poly as possible for games. If you guys would rather it, I wont post my work for you.
